text.section: In this title the following words have the meanings indicated.

"Base period" means:
the first 4 of the last 5 completed calendar quarters immediately preceding the start of the benefit year; or
the 4 most recently completed calendar quarters immediately preceding the start of the benefit year only if the individual applying for benefits does not qualify for any benefits under § 8-802 of this title using the definition in item (1) of this subsection.
"Base period employer" means an employing unit who paid wages to an individual during the base period of the individual for covered employment.

"Benefit year" means a 1-year period that begins:
on the 1st day of the 1st week for which an individual first files a claim for benefits; or
if an individual already has had a benefit year, on the 1st day of the 1st week for which the individual files a claim for benefits after the termination of the preceding benefit year.
"Benefits" means the money that is payable under this title to an individual who is unemployed.
"Board of Appeals" means the Board of Appeals of the Department of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation.
"Calendar quarter" means the period of 3 consecutive calendar months ending on March 31, June 30, September 30, or December 31, except as otherwise provided by the Secretary by regulation.

"Child support" means an obligation that is enforced under a plan that:
is described in § 454 of the Social Security Act; and
has been approved by the United States Secretary of Health and Human Services under Part D of Title IV of the Social Security Act.

"Child support enforcement unit" means a unit of a state or political subdivision of a state that operates under a plan that:
is described in § 454 of the Social Security Act; and
has been approved by the United States Secretary of Health and Human Services under Part D of Title IV of the Social Security Act.
"Claimant" means an individual who submits a claim for benefits.
"Contributions" means money required to be paid to the Unemployment Insurance Fund under § 8-607 of this title.
"Covered employment" means work that an individual performs for an employing unit that is the basis for benefits.
"Department" means the Department of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation.

section.section: "Educational institution" means an institution that offers participants, students, or trainees an organized course of study or training that is academic, technical, trade-oriented, or preparatory for gainful employment in a recognized occupation.
"Educational institution" includes an institution of higher education.

text.section: "Employer" means a person or governmental entity who employs at least 1 individual within the State.

"Employing unit" means:
an employer that has at least 1 employee engaged in covered employment for at least part of a day;
an employer that has elected to become subject to this title under § 8-203 of this title; or
an employer that is not otherwise subject to this title but that:
within the current or preceding calendar year, is liable for any federal tax against which credit may be taken for contributions required to be paid into a State unemployment fund; or
as a condition for approval for full credit of contributions against the tax imposed by the Federal Unemployment Tax Act, is required by that Act to be an employing unit.

"Governmental entity" means:
a governmental unit as defined in § 1-101 of this article; or
an instrumentality of:
1 or more states;
1 or more political subdivisions of a state; or
1 or more states and political subdivisions of states.
"Hospital" has the meaning stated in § 19-301 of the Health - General Article.

section.section:
"Institution of higher education" means an educational institution that:
is a public or other not for profit institution;
is authorized to provide in the State a program of education beyond high school; and
admits as regular students only individuals with a certificate of graduation from high school or a recognized equivalent certificate for:
"Institution of higher education" includes each college and university in the State.

text.section: "Lower Appeals Division" means the Lower Appeals Division of the Department of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation.

"Not for profit organization" means an organization that is:
described in § 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code; and
exempt from income tax under § 501(a) of the Internal Revenue Code.

"Part-time worker" means an individual:
whose availability for work is restricted to part-time work; and
who worked at least 20 hours per week in part-time work for a majority of the weeks of work in the base period.
"Secretary" means the Secretary of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation.

section.section: "State" has the meaning stated in § 1-101 of this article.

"State" does not include a territory of the United States unless the territory enacted an unemployment insurance law that complies with the standards adopted by the Secretary of Labor of the United States under the Federal Unemployment Tax Act or Title III of the Social Security Act.

text.section:
"Tip" means compensation that:
an individual receives from a customer of the individual's employer while performing covered employment; and
is included in a written statement provided to the employer under § 6053(a) of the Internal Revenue Code.

section.section: "Wages" means all compensation for personal services except as provided in paragraph (3) of this subsection.

text.section: "Week" means a period of 7 consecutive days, as the Secretary sets by regulation.
